message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study uses data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and the International Finance Corporation's Doing Business database to investigate the relationship between business environment and export performance of firms in South Asia.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "International Finance Corporation's Doing Business"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "We examine the causal impact of enabling access to formal credit on the micro-entrepreneurial activities of women using data from the Impact Evaluation of the Alofin-Kiva social program in Togo and Benin.", "dataset": ["Impact Evaluation of the Alofin-Kiva social program"], "topic": ["Gender"]}, {"sentence": "Using household survey data from Nigeria, we compare the performance of synthetic control methods with propensity score matching and linear regression methods at estimating counterfactual outcomes in impact evaluations.", "dataset": ["household survey data from Nigeria"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This article brings together city and industry level datasets to explore the extent to which cities in Uganda are able to generate and sustain growth in manufacturing activity.", "dataset": ["city-level datasets", "industry-level datasets"], "topic": ["Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "We exploit a unique dataset of informal firms in Tanzania to investigate how time-based and output-based incentive schemes affect the perfomance of casual agricultural laborers.", "dataset": ["unique dataset of informal firms in Tanzania"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We combine satellite imagery and household surveys to estimate the effects of climate variability on maize yields in southern Malawi.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery", "household surveys"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Using administrative data from the National Social Security Fund of China and the Mozi Health insurance enrollment system, we investigate the effect of health insurance coverage on occupational mobility of rural workers.", "dataset": ["National Social Security Fund of China", "Mozi Health insurance enrollment system"], "topic": ["Health", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We employ both qualitative and quantitative datasets to examine the socioeconomic impacts of a large flood disaster in Thailand, including changes in poverty rates, public health outcomes, and displacement patterns.", "dataset": ["qualitative datasets", "quantitative datasets"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Poverty", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses three years of transactional data from online lending platforms to explore how lenders' biased behaviors based on gender affect female borrowers' access to credit in India.", "dataset": ["three years of transactional data from online lending platforms"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "We build on existing datasets to construct a newly geo-located database of illegal coca cultivation areas in Colombia, which we link to officially reported incidents of violent clashes between local communities and drug traffickers.", "dataset": ["datasets on illegal coca cultivation areas", "officially reported incidents"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Extractive Industries"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This study uses data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and the International Finance Corporation's Doing Business database to investigate the relationship between business environment and export performance of firms in South Asia.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "International Finance Corporation's Doing Business"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, sustain growth in manufacturing activity.", "dataset": ["city-level datasets", "industry-level datasets"], "topic": ["Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "We exploit a unique dataset of informal firms in Tanzania to investigate how time-based and output-based incentive schemes affect the perfomance of casual agricultural laborers.", "dataset": ["unique dataset of informal firms in Tanzania"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We combine satellite imagery and household surveys to estimate the effects of climate variability on maize yields in southern Malawi.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery", "household surveys"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Using administrative data from the National Social Security Fund of China and the Mozi Health insurance enrollment system, we investigate the effect of health insurance coverage on occupational mobility of rural workers.", "dataset": ["National Social Security Fund of China", "Mozi Health insurance enrollment system"], "topic": ["Health", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We employ both qualitative and quantitative datasets to examine the socioeconomic impacts of a large flood disaster in Thailand, including changes in poverty rates, public health outcomes, and displacement patterns.", "dataset": ["qualitative datasets", "quantitative datasets"], "topic": ["Disaster female borrowers' access to credit in India.", "dataset": ["three years of transactional data from online lending platforms"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "We build on existing datasets to construct a newly geo-located database of illegal coca cultivation areas in Colombia, which we link to officially reported incidents of violent clashes between local communities and drug traffickers.", "dataset": ["datasets on illegal coca cultivation areas", "officially reported incidents"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Extractive Industries"]}]
